form.PN:
Lead
izgovarjamo
/l*i*:d/
, razen pri 17. in 18. pomenu, kjer besedo izgovarjamo
/l*ed/
.

sense.def:
To lead someone somewhere
pomeni iti pred nekom, da mu pokažemo pot.

seg.quote: He led a demonstration through the City.
My mother takes me by the hand and leads me downstairs.
Jenny was leading and I was at the back.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj, na primer cesta, cev ali žica,
leads somewhere
, nekam gre.

seg.quote: ...the main street leading to the centre of the city.

sense.def:
Kadar vrata ali lesa
leads to a place
, lahko v neki kraj pridemo tako, da gremo skozi vrata ali leso.

seg.quote: There was a gate on our left leading into a field.

sense.def:
To be leading in a race or competition
pomeni zmagovati na dirki ali tekmovanju.

To be in the lead
pomeni zmagati na dirki ali tekmovanju.

seg.quote: This win gave him the overall lead.

sense.def:
To lead a group or organization
pomeni biti uradno odgovoren za neko skupino ali organizacijo.

seg.quote: The Labour Party was led by Wilson.
He lacked any desire to lead.

sense.def:
To lead an activity
pomeni začeti ali voditi neko dejavnost.

seg.quote: The rioting was led by students.

sense.def:
To give a lead
pomeni storiti nekaj, kar velja za dober primer, ki mu je treba slediti.

seg.quote: The European Community should give a lead.
Other firms are now following the company's lead.

sense.def:
To lead an exciting or dull life
pomeni imeti razburljivo ali dolgočasno življenje.

seg.quote: My friends seemed to be leading a much more exciting life.

sense.def:
One thing leads to another
rečemo, kadar prva stvar povzroči, da se zgodi druga.

seg.quote: ...a drinking spree which had led to his court appearance.

gramGrp.pos:
VB
with
OBJ
and
TO-INF
or
ADJUNCT

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
leads someone to do something
, vpliva ali učinkuje na nekoga, da nekaj stori.

seg.quote: Recent evidence is leading historians to reassess that event.
This led him to an obsession with art.

sense.def:
A dog's lead
je dolga, tanka veriga ali usnjen trak, ki ga psu pripnemo na ovratnico, da ga lahko vodimo.

V kosu električne opreme je
a lead
žica, po kateri vanj priteka električni tok.

V igri ali filmu je
the lead
najpomembnejša vloga v njem.

seg.quote: Richard was signed up to play the lead.

sense.def:
V pop skupini je
the lead singer
pevec, ki poje glavno melodijo.

A lead
je tudi podatek, ki policiji lahko pomaga razrešiti zločin.

Lead
je mehka, siva, težka kovina.

V svinčniku je
the lead
središčni del, ki pušča sled na papirju.

To lead the way
pomeni iti pred nekom, da mu pokažemo, kam mora iti.

seg.quote: I led the way to Andrew's cabin.

sense.def:
To take the lead
pomeni začeti nekaj delati pred drugimi.

seg.quote: France took the lead in the development of the airbus.

sense.def:
Kadar dogodki
lead up to a situation
, se zgodijo drug za drugim, dokler ne nastanejo določene okoliščine.

seg.quote: ...the chain of events that led up to her death.

sense.def:
To lead up to a particular subject in a conversation
pomeni postopoma peljati pogovor do točke, ko lahko načnemo določeno témo.

seg.quote: Ever since you came in you've been leading up to this one question.
